unnormalised: ## Basket Bhool Gaye? Don't be a 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' with your Cart!
normalised: ## Basket Bhool Gaye? Don't be a 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' with your Cart!

unnormalised: Ever added a gorgeous saree from Banarasi Babu's online store, dreamt of rocking it at your cousin Priya's wedding in Delhi, only to… forget it's still sitting in your cart? You're not alone, bhai! We've all been there. It's called cart abandonment, and it’s like forgetting your chai at a tapri – a tragic waste!

unnormalised: In the wild world of e-commerce, cart abandonment is a bigger problem than finding a decent parking spot at Linking Road on a Sunday. Studies at IIM-Ahmedabad show that approximately 70% of online shopping carts get abandoned. 70%! That's enough silk sarees to drape the entire Red Fort!

unnormalised: But why does this happen? Maybe you got distracted by a notification about a crazy sale on Flipkart. Maybe your wifi decided to play 'Kaho Naa… Pyaar Hai' with you at the crucial moment of payment. Maybe your cat, Mittu, decided your laptop was the perfect napping spot. Whatever the reason, that poor saree is still languishing in your digital basket, feeling as neglected as Rahul from Kuch Kuch Hota Hai before he got a makeover.

unnormalised: So, what can online retailers do to win back these runaway shoppers? Well, a little reminder email never hurt anyone, right? Especially one with a tempting discount code! Maybe offer free shipping for orders over Rs. 500. Or even just a friendly "Hey, remember that awesome saree you almost bought?"

unnormalised: Think of it this way: a happy customer is a repeat customer. And a repeat customer means more business than you can shake a dhol at! So, let's all try to be a little more mindful of our online carts, and a little less like a 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa' character wandering lost in the maze of the internet. Happy Shopping!
